flow.descriptionCdata:
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.040504c5-2176-464d-b31b-9beeef4f8e7f.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,paused). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.0a382f7f-4d83-4135-ac80-e47888f3df41.description=
Retrieves the configured number of CPUs for a virtual machine.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).

Responses\:
success - Successfully retrieved the number of CPUs configured for the virtual machine.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
vmCpuCount - Number of CPUs configured for the virtual machine

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.211e8fc3-52ba-4068-aaaa-c5ed0a59e5cf.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.350daae3-7e40-4fde-8ed1-ea297efc95d5.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.35a86a0b-10c3-4469-8477-76bf32725152.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.3df83850-4098-4d54-80c1-7a137c3ed8bd.description=
Loops as many number of times as specified in the input, that is, counts from 1 to another number incrementing by 1 for each iteration.

Inputs\:
count - Number of loops to complete.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from 1.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Responses\:
has more 	- Counting has not completed, one or more iterations are pending.
no more 	- Counting completed. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure 	- Something went wrong.
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.4a039450-1cd7-4129-8c06-d1946f94f87e.description=
Sets the number of CPUs for a virtual machine.  The virtual machine must be in a powered off state for this operation to succeed.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation? Valid values\: true or false.
async - Asynchronously perform the task.
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmCpuCount - New number of CPUs for the virtual machine.

Responses\:
success - If async is true the task was successfuly queued.  If async is false the CPU count for the virtual machine was successfully set.
failure - Something went wrong.  See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
CPU limits\: The maximum value for vmCpuCount is based on the virtual hardware version of the virtual machine. Limits are as follows\:
  Virtual hardware 7 (ESX 4.0)\: 8
  Virtual hardware 4 (ESX 3.x)\: 4
  Virtual hardware 3 (ESX 2.5)\: 2
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.4c514cba-959b-46b9-b33b-19f838b58a02.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.574f4ccb-5012-48a8-8b52-6646117bdd19.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.74acd277-dcc7-4629-9297-54e265bb9e4d.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:

ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal

responses\:

e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.7b0a2f85-6af3-4149-93f7-c7c706b0af0f.description=

e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.7ca5c549-a311-45b1-b537-8e2ad876185b.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.8f22ece1-2748-48de-a03a-cbe18e447653.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,paused). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.a81ea707-a266-4f4f-82c1-20520bd74a34.description=
Sets the memory size for a virtual machine. The virtual machine must be in a powered off state for this operation to succeed.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation? Valid values\: true or false.
async - Asynchronously perform the task.
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmMemorySize - New memory size for the virtual machine in megabytes.

Responses\:
success - If async is true the task was successfuly queued.  If async is false the memory size for the virtual machine was successfully set.
failure - Something went wrong.  See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
Memory limits\: The maximum value for vmMemorySize is based on the virtual hardware version of the virtual machine. Limits are as follows\:
  Virtual hardware 7 (ESX 4.0)\: 261120
  Virtual hardware 4 (ESX 3.x)\: 65532
  Virtual hardware 3 (ESX 2.5)\: 3600
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.b89404b3-09be-46ed-a0a9-360e5916eb63.description=
Retrieves the configured memory size for a virtual machine in megabytes.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).

Responses\:
success - Successfully retrieved the number of megabytes of memory configured for the virtual machine.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
vmMemorySize - Megabytes of memory configured for the virtual machine

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.

Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.c94e101a-5c8f-4848-9ab2-5ae79da1e0e3.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,paused). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.d99a4464-869e-4ab3-b672-cec5841aa10f.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.description=
Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested.

Input Parameters\:
 serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow
 VCenterHost -  vCenter host to execute against
 VCenterUsername - vCenter username
 VCenterPassword - vCenter password.
 virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed.
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have.
 memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have.
 addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm.

Responses\:
   success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0
   failure - otherwise

Result Fields\:
 NA
e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.e31f4e70-d6c3-4a26-af0e-d7a27e742e5b.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.f1d8a4ab-575d-4d8d-a34f-8f6a2e883b04.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e9665f71-68e0-4dae-b1fe-1496a067d38c.fda8db72-33b8-4650-9d59-e7170862c6d8.description=
Retrieve power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task completion return message.
powerState - Power state (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
flow.name: vCenter Set CPU And Mem
